intro: Koeleria reuteri, commonly known as the purple needlegrass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and delicate blue to purple flower spikes. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. Koeleria reuteri is often found in disturbed soils and is an important component of native plant communities in arid regions.
